intro: Iris babadagica, commonly known as the Caucasian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its upright, grass-like leaves and striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained soils, often found in woodland or alpine environments. The flowers are often used in traditional medicine and are also appreciated for their ornamental value in gardens.
